thing-type.label: FGWDEU Fibaro Walli Dimmer
thing-type.description: Fibaro Walli Dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFIBARO Walli Dimmer is a smart wall dimmer designed to control light source via Z-Wave network. It measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load. You can install it with provided cover plate and switch button or other compatible.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSet the main controller into the adding mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times click one of the buttons.</li&gt <li&gtIf you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.</li&gt <li&gtAdding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame: <ul&gt<li&gtGreen – successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtMagenta – successful (Security S2 Authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtRed – not successful.</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSet the main controller in remove mode (see the controller's manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times click one of the buttons.</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.</li&gt <li&gtThe device will start calibrating the load.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Remember device state
parameter.description: Determines how the device will react in the event of power supply failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines how the device will react in the event of power supply failure (e.g. power outage). </p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1 (restores the state) </p&gt <p&gtAvailable values: </p&gt <p&gt0 – remains switched off after restoring power </p&gt <p&gt1 – restores remembered state after restoring power</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: remains switched off after restoring power
restores remembered state after restoring power

parameter.name: config_2_4
parameter.label: 2: Overload safety switch
parameter.description: Turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis function allows to turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device can be turned back on via the button or sending a control frame.</p&gt <p&gt0 – function disabled<br /&gt10-5000 (1.0-500.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_4
parameter.label: 10: LED frame – power limit
parameter.description: Determines maximum active power.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines maximum active power. Exceeding it results in the LED frame flashing violet. Function is active only when parameter 11 is set to 8 or 9.</p&gt <p&gt100-5000 (10.0-500.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: LED frame – colour when ON
parameter.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device is ON.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the LED colour when the device is ON.</p&gt <p&gtWhen set to 8 or 9, LED frame colour will change depending on the measured power and parameter 10. Other colours are set permanently and do not depend on power consumption.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – LED disabled</p&gt <p&gt1 – White</p&gt <p&gt2 – Red</p&gt <p&gt3 – Green</p&gt <p&gt4 – Blue</p&gt <p&gt5 – Yellow</p&gt <p&gt6 – Cyan</p&gt <p&gt7 – Magenta</p&gt <p&gt8 – colour changes smoothly depending on measured power</p&gt <p&gt9 – colour changes in steps depending on measured power</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: LED frame – colour when OFF
parameter.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device is OFF.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable values: 0 – LED disabled 1 – White 2 – Red 3 – Green 4 – Blue 5 – Yellow 6 – Cyan 7 – Magenta</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: LED frame – brightness
parameter.description: This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – LED disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-100 (1-100% brightness)</p&gt <p&gt101 – brightness directly proportional to set level</p&gt <p&gt102 – brightness inversely proportional to set level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Buttons orientation
parameter.description: This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – default (1st button brightens, 2nd button dims)</p&gt <p&gt1 – reversed (1st button dims, 2nd button brightens)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_4_0000000F
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
parameter.description: determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action:</p&gt <p&gt0x00 – no action,<br /&gt0xX1 – turn ON,<br /&gt0xX2 – turn OFF,<br /&gt0xX3 – turn ON/OFF continuously,<br /&gt0x0X – no action on LED frame,<br /&gt0x1X – LED frame blinks red,<br /&gt0x2X – LED frame blinks green,<br /&gt0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,<br /&gt0x8X – disable LED frame,<br /&gt0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_4_0000000F
parameter.label: 31: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
parameter.description: determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 4B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value</p&gt <p&gt[0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00]</p&gt <p&gt(Water Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action:</p&gt <p&gt0x00 – no action,<br /&gt0xX1 – turn ON,<br /&gt0xX2 – turn OFF,<br /&gt0xX3 – turn ON/OFF continuously,<br /&gt0x0X – no action on LED frame,<br /&gt0x1X – LED frame blinks red,<br /&gt0x2X – LED frame blinks green,<br /&gt0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,<br /&gt0x8X – disable LED frame,<br /&gt0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_4_0000000F
parameter.label: 32: Alarm configuration - 3rd slot
parameter.description: determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 4B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value</p&gt <p&gt[0x01, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00]</p&gt <p&gt(Smoke Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action:</p&gt <p&gt0x00 – no action,<br /&gt0xX1 – turn ON,<br /&gt0xX2 – turn OFF,<br /&gt0xX3 – turn ON/OFF continuously,<br /&gt0x0X – no action on LED frame,<br /&gt0x1X – LED frame blinks red,<br /&gt0x2X – LED frame blinks green,<br /&gt0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,<br /&gt0x8X – disable LED frame,<br /&gt0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_4_0000000F
parameter.label: 33: Alarm configuration - 4th slot
parameter.description: determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 4B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value</p&gt <p&gt[0x02, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00]</p&gt <p&gt(CO Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action:</p&gt <p&gt0x00 – no action,<br /&gt0xX1 – turn ON,<br /&gt0xX2 – turn OFF,<br /&gt0xX3 – turn ON/OFF continuously,<br /&gt0x0X – no action on LED frame,<br /&gt0x1X – LED frame blinks red,<br /&gt0x2X – LED frame blinks green,<br /&gt0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,<br /&gt0x8X – disable LED frame,<br /&gt0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_34_4_0000000F
parameter.label: 34: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
parameter.description: determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 4B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value</p&gt <p&gt[0x04, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00]</p&gt <p&gt(Heat Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action:</p&gt <p&gt0x00 – no action,<br /&gt0xX1 – turn ON,<br /&gt0xX2 – turn OFF,<br /&gt0xX3 – turn ON/OFF continuously,<br /&gt0x0X – no action on LED frame,<br /&gt0x1X – LED frame blinks red,<br /&gt0x2X – LED frame blinks green,<br /&gt0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,<br /&gt0x8X – disable LED frame,<br /&gt0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_35_2
parameter.label: 35: Alarm configuration – duration
parameter.description: defines duration of alarm sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – infinite</p&gt <p&gt1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: First button – scenes sent
parameter.description: determines which actions result in sending scene IDs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).</p&gt <p&gtEnabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0 (no scenes)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1 – Key pressed 1 time</p&gt <p&gt2 – Key pressed 2 times</p&gt <p&gt4 – Key pressed 3 times</p&gt <p&gt8 – Key hold down and key released</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: Second button – scenes sent
parameter.description: determines which actions result in sending scene IDs

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: Power reports – include self-consumption
parameter.description: determines whether the power measurements should include self-consumption<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines whether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0 (not included)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – Self-consumption not included</p&gt <p&gt1 – Self-consumption included</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_61_2
parameter.label: 61: Power reports – on change
parameter.description: defines minimal change to be reported<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 15 (15%)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – reporting on change disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-500 (1-500%, 1% step) – minimal change</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_62_2_wo
parameter.label: 62: Power reports – periodic
parameter.description: defines reporting interval for measured power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 61).</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 3600 (1h)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – periodic reports disabled</p&gt <p&gt30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_65_2
parameter.label: 65: Energy reports – on change
parameter.description: defines minimal change to be reported<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that results in sending new report.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 10 (0.1kWh)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – reporting on change disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-500 (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_66_2
parameter.label: 66: Energy reports – periodic
parameter.description: defines reporting interval for measured energy<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 65).</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 3600 (1h)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – periodic reports disabled</p&gt <p&gt30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_150_1
parameter.label: 150: Minimum brightness level
parameter.description: Minimum brightness level - initialised at calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is set automatically during the calibration process, but can be changed manually after the calibration.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1-98 (1-98%, 1% step) – level of brightness</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_151_1
parameter.label: 151: Maximum brightness level
parameter.description: Maximum brightness level - initalised at calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is set automatically during the calibration process, but can be changed manually after the calibration.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 99</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt2-99 (2-99%, 1% step) – level of brightness</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_152_1
parameter.label: 152: Incandescence level of compact fluorescent lamps
parameter.description: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The device will set to this value after the first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1-99 (1-98%, 1% step) – level of brightness</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_153_2
parameter.label: 153: Incandescence time of compact fluorescent lamps
parameter.description: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0-255 (0-25.5s, 0.1s step) – incandescence time</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_154_1
parameter.label: 154: Automatic control – dimming step size
parameter.description: defines the percentage value of dimming step<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the automatic control.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1-99 (1-99%, 1% step) – dimming step</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_155_2
parameter.label: 155: Automatic control – time of dimming step
parameter.description: Automatic control – time of dimming step<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the time of performing a single dimming step set in parameter 154 during the automatic control.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1 (10ms)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0-255 (0-2.55s, 10ms step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_156_1
parameter.label: 156: Manual control – dimming step size
parameter.description: Manual control – dimming step size<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the percentage value of the dimming step during the manual control.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt1-99 (1-99%, 1% step) – dimming step</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_157_2
parameter.label: 157: Manual control – time of dimming step
parameter.description: Manual control – time of dimming step<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the time of performing a single dimming step set in parameter 156 during the manual control.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 5 (50ms)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0-255 (0-2.55s, 10ms step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_158_2
parameter.label: 158: Auto-off functionality
parameter.description: Auto-off functionality<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to automatically switch off the device after a specified time from switching the light source on. It may be useful when the device is installed in the stairway.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – auto-off disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-32767 (1s-9.1h, 1s step) – auto-off time</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_159_1
parameter.label: 159: Force auto-calibration
parameter.description: Force auto-calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtChanging value of this parameter will force the calibration process. During the calibration parameter is set to 1 or 2 and switched to 0 upon completion.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – readout</p&gt <p&gt1 – force auto-calibration without FIBARO Bypass 2</p&gt <p&gt2 – force auto-calibration with FIBARO Bypass 2</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_160_1
parameter.label: 160: Auto-calibration status (read-only)
parameter.description: Auto-calibration status (read-only parameter)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines operating mode of the device (automatic/manual settings).</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – calibration procedure not performed or the device operates on manual settings</p&gt <p&gt1 – the device operates on auto-calibration settings</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_161_1
parameter.label: 161: Burnt out bulb detection
parameter.description: Burnt out bulb detection<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines percentage power variation (compared to power consumption measured during the calibration) to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – function disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-99 (1-99%, 1% step) – power variation</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_162_2
parameter.label: 162: Delay of a burnt out bulb and overload detection
parameter.description: Time delay of a burnt out bulb and overload detection<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines detection delay for the burnt out bulb (parameter 161) and overload (parameter 2).</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 5</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – detection of a burnt out bulb disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-255 (1-255s, 1s step) – time delay</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_163_2
parameter.label: 163: 1st button ON value sent to association groups
parameter.description: First button – Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 255</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0-99, 255 – value sent</p&gt <p&gt254 – send value equal to the current level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_164_2
parameter.label: 164: 2nd button OFF value sent to association groups
parameter.description: Second button – Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0-99, 255 – value sent</p&gt <p&gt254 – send value equal to the current level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_165_1
parameter.label: 165: Double click – set level
parameter.description: Double click – set level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines brightness level set after double-clicking any of the buttons. The same value is also sent to devices associated with 2nd and 3rd association group.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 99</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0-99 (0-99%, 1% step) – set level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_170_1
parameter.label: 170: Load control mode
parameter.description: Load control mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set the desired load control mode. Auto-calibration sets value of this parameter to 2 (control mode recognized during auto-calibration), but the installer may force control mode using this parameter.</p&gt <p&gtAfter changing parameter value, turn the load OFF and ON to change control mode.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 2</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – forced leading edge</p&gt <p&gt1 – forced trailing edge</p&gt <p&gt2 – control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_171_1
parameter.label: 171: Load control mode recognized
parameter.description: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to read load control mode that was set during auto-calibration.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: –</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – leading edge</p&gt <p&gt1 – trailing edge</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_172_1
parameter.label: 172: ON/OFF mode
parameter.description: ON/OFF mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Setting this parameter to 1 automatically ignores brightening/dimming time settings. Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter’s value to 2.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 2</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – ON/OFF mode disabled (dimming is possible)</p&gt <p&gt1 – ON/OFF mode enabled (dimming is not possible)</p&gt <p&gt2 – mode selected automatically</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_173_1
parameter.label: 173: Dimmability of the load (read only)
parameter.description: Dimmability of the load (read only)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to read if the load detected during calibration procedure is dimmable.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: —</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – load recognized as dimmable</p&gt <p&gt1 – load recognized as non-dimmable</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_174_1
parameter.label: 174: Soft-start functionality
parameter.description: Soft-start functionality<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – no soft-start</p&gt <p&gt1 – short soft-start (0.1s)</p&gt <p&gt2 – long soft-start (0.5s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_175_1
parameter.label: 175: Auto-calibration after power on
parameter.description: Auto-calibration after power on<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 1</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – no auto-calibration after power on</p&gt <p&gt2 – Auto-calibration after each power on</p&gt <p&gt3 – Auto-calibration after each LOAD ERROR (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 176 is set to 1 also after SURGE (output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (output overcurrent)</p&gt <p&gt4 – Auto-calibration after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 176 is set to 1 also after SURGE (output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (output overcurrent)</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Auto-calibratie after each power on or LOAD ERROR

parameter.name: config_176_1
parameter.label: 176: Behaviour after OVERCURRENT or SURGE
parameter.description: Behaviour after OVERCURRENT or SURGE

options.option: three attempts to turn on the load

parameter.name: config_177_2
parameter.label: 177: Brightness level correction flickering
parameter.description: Brightness level correction for flickering loads<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtCorrection reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive loads (e.g. dimmable LEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation.</p&gt <p&gtIn countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust the time of correction for flickering loads.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 255</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – automatic correction disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-254 (1-254s, 1s step) – duration of correction</p&gt <p&gt255 – automatic correction always enabled</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_178_1
parameter.label: 178: Method of calculating the active power
parameter.description: Method of calculating the active power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines how to calculate active power. It is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 1B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0 – measurement based on the standard algorithm</p&gt <p&gt1 – approximation based on the calibration data</p&gt <p&gt2 – approximation based on the control angle</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_179_2
parameter.label: 179: Approximated power at max brightness
parameter.description: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level.</p&gt <p&gtParameter size: 2B</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: 0</p&gt <p&gtAvailable values:</p&gt <p&gt0-500 (0-500W, 1W step) – power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Lifeline

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: 2nd association group
parameter.description: “On/Off” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting button operation (uses Basic command class).

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: 3rd association group
parameter.description: "Dimmer” is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation (uses Switch Multilevel command class).
